page.title: 04Commander Gammon (contd)
page.content: { { {Sea walls}were built in{1815}and{1857} and{Horsey Island}was reclaimed. The sea wall (bank) was built with clay and pebble into which pitch _ paving was driven. This bank was broken in December{1910}and hundreds of sheep were drowned. {Commander Gammon's}talk reminded us of the surge tide of{October 26th 1984 when part of{Crow Point}was washed away by a ferocious gale. Fortunately, the wall is now able to withstand a surge tide but, on that day many houses and cars were flooded in{ {Barnstaple.}({Mr Little,}our teacher's car was flooded too!).
